problem_statement.issue: Three different WebSocket communication patterns causing chaos

symptoms.symptom: Duplicate WebSocket event methods in 3+ locations
Mixed usage of bridge and manager patterns

impact.technical: Race conditions, duplicate events, maintenance nightmares
impact.business: Unreliable chat experience, lost user trust

root_cause.primary: Lack of SSOT enforcement during WebSocket evolution

contributing.factor: Transitional code left in place too long

architecture.principle: All agents inherit from BaseSubAgent which provides emit_* methods

implementation.step: Replaced notify_* methods with emit_* methods
Added deprecation warnings for backward compatibility
Unified all agents to use WebSocketBridgeAdapter

file.change: Removed send_direct_websocket_event and all notify_* methods
Removed websocket_manager checks, use emit_* methods
Removed bridge import, deprecated duplicate send_* methods

validation.test: WebSocket pattern verification script confirms 100% SSOT compliance
All critical files follow unified pattern

key_learnings.learning: NEVER allow multiple patterns for the same functionality. Enforce SSOT from day one or technical debt compounds exponentially.
Transitional code must have expiration dates. Set hard deadlines for removing backward compatibility layers.
WebSocket communication is mission-critical infrastructure. It must have a single, clear, documented pattern that all developers follow.
The emit_* pattern through WebSocketBridgeAdapter is the ONLY approved method for WebSocket events in agent code.

prevention.rule: All new agents MUST inherit from BaseSubAgent
Direct bridge imports are FORBIDDEN in agent files
WebSocket events MUST use emit_* methods only
Run WebSocket pattern verification in CI/CD

completion_status.description: Complete SSOT WebSocket bridge migration with comprehensive audit finished. All agents now use unified WebSocket Bridge Pattern with 100% SSOT compliance.
